Reveals personal knowledge about Penny's past in a blunt manner.
Expresses caution and tries to dissuade Penny from making a potentially risky decision (going to New York) without full information.

Engages Penny in conversation that reveals personal truths and builds trust, indicating social perceptiveness.
Fails to provide clear guidance or decisive action despite sensing danger or complications.
Attempts humor and vulnerability by admitting confusion and insecurity about the relationship.
Expresses upset and jealousy openly, showing emotional sincerity.

Sputters and asks for clarity about Penny's past relationships instead of calmly addressing his jealousy.
Expresses confusion about 'real world' and struggles to keep grip on reality and relationships.
Displays emotional vulnerability and inability to assert himself confidently in a conversation with Penny.
Uses sarcasm and self-characterization ('dark and mysterious and pissed off') as a defense mechanism.
Acknowledges that another disc-jockey got a better interview, indicating some self-awareness and competitive awareness.
Blurts out 'sold you to Humble Pie for fifty dollars and a case of beer?', then instantly feels sorry.
Blurts out an emotional accusation impulsively and then instantly regrets it, showing lack of control and thoughtfulness.
Tries to follow Penny despite his frustration, indicating persistence and engagement.
Crawls out of the limo last, quietly observing the band and fans without interrupting.
Turns to look for Penny when Dick says ‘She's here’, showing his attentiveness to others.
Accepts help from others with his spilled belongings, showing vulnerability and openness.
Uses a deep voice on the phone, adopting a new persona, which may indicate discomfort or insincerity.
Handles the embarrassment of his bag breaking and spilling contents in public calmly.
Reacting to Ric's information about the party and people staying under false names thoughtfully, showing awareness and absorption of relevant details.
Adopts a new persona with a deep voice when taking an urgent phone call, indicating adaptability and confidence.
Hustles to the Daily News office late at night to transmit story pages promptly.
Appears overwhelmed and fearful but persists in completing his tasks.
No indication of unfriendly or cold behavior; accepts help from Dennis Hope to gain entry.
Tells Russell that he loves the band when Russell expresses doubt.
Peels in silence while Russell vents, listening quietly without interrupting.
Approaches Russell with good news, showing engagement and desire to share positive information.

Maintains composure and listens silently while Russell vents worries and doubts.
Attempts to share good news and engage Russell positively.
Exits conversation prematurely and trails Russell without resolving the intended communication.
Observes social dynamics discreetly, sharing a knowing look with Penny, indicating awareness of the situation.
Shares exciting news with the band about being on the cover of Rolling Stone, creating a moment of joy and solidarity.
Claims Penny Lane is with him, standing by her when others confront her, then follows her when she runs away.
Runs through the city alone, searching anxiously for Penny after she flees, showing care and concern.
Tells the band they will be on the cover of Rolling Stone, delivering big news confidently and significantly.
Immediately takes initiative to follow Penny when she runs out, showing decisiveness and responsibility.
Looks for Penny in cabs amid a crowd in unfamiliar territory, showing resourcefulness and persistence.

Signs for the expensive champagne and patiently waits while the room clears, then finds Penny Lane nearly passed out and immediately seeks medical help by calling the front desk and requesting a doctor.
Struggles to help Penny Lane stand and unties her shoes when she tips over, showing care and concern for her well-being.
Identifies himself as a friend of Penny Lane to the musicians, indicating loyalty and connection.
Signs for the expensive champagne delivery on behalf of the party, demonstrating confidence and taking initiative.
Locates Penny Lane despite a chaotic environment and takes immediate action to help her when she is incapacitated.
Calls the front desk promptly to request a doctor for Penny Lane, showing quick thinking in an emergency.
Struggles with practical help (e.g., trying to get Penny Lane on her feet and untie her shoes), showing some lack of grace or skill in physical assistance.
Holds Penny in his arms and shares an intimate, slow dance, engaging warmly in playful dialogue with her.
Absent from his own graduation ceremony, causing visible pain to his mother Elaine, suggesting emotional distance or avoidance.

Comforts Penny Lane tenderly, holds her in his arms during a slow dance
Encourages Penny to keep reciting and remembers details of the safety speech
Expresses sincere love and vulnerability to Penny despite the difficult circumstances.
Holds Penny gently while she is very woozy and tired, tries to express his feelings honestly and vulnerably despite nervousness.
Attempts casual, somewhat awkward declaration of love, showing emotional openness but also a lack of confidence in social skill.
Sits quietly on the bed while medical professionals take over, demonstrating appropriate restraint and understanding of the situation.
Thanks the Doctor politely despite the difficult situation.

Patiently assists and guides Penny through the airport despite her irritability and their exhaustion.
Thanked the doctor politely and acknowledged the girl's confusion, showing calmness in a stressful medical situation.

Managed to guide and support Penny through the airport while being tired and dealing with her difficult mood, displaying persistence and care under challenging conditions.

Expresses horror and surprise about Penny's unusual name, showing emotional reaction but no clear problem-solving or skillful behavior.
Watches Penny from the terminal window and waves, showing attention and caring but not an indicator of skill or confidence.
Runs alongside the plane, trying to communicate and connect by mouthing 'I'll see you back home!'
Feels pain when not joining party and missing introduction to Bob Dylan, seems to desire connection but withdraws.
Stares straight ahead, increasingly nervous, during the turbulent plane ride, showing controlled attention despite fear.
Does not vocalize panic or attempt to take control during the emergency landing situation, remaining a passive observer.

Speaks up emotionally against the band’s mistreatment of a fan, showing genuine concern and moral courage.
Remains mostly silent and catatonic during heated conflicts, showing passivity and avoidance.

Hustles to catch up with the band after a crisis but is ignored by them.
Stands apart silently as the band moves on without him, showing restraint and not forcing interaction.
Waves a heartfelt goodbye to the band who are still shell-shocked, showing sincerity and tolerance.
Hustles back to catch up to the band despite being ignored, showing persistence and determination.
Stops at the fork in the airport terminal and unintentionally parts ways with the band, indicating a moment of disconnection and lack of awareness.
Watches the band’s backs as they leave him behind but remains composed and accepts the parting.
Finds and points to San Francisco on the airport departure schedule, demonstrating focus and clear direction.
Insists he is a writer despite exhaustion and being treated skeptically by others.
Remains silent and speechless when criticized about his writing and perceived failure.
Insists he is a writer, not just a messenger, despite being exhausted and young.
Presents a story that editors find lacking depth and personal insight; sits speechless when confronted with criticism.
Arrives prepared with notes and a story after eight days on the road with the band.
Fails to argue or defend his piece effectively in the editorial meeting, showing hesitation and lack of confidence.
Insists on finishing his unfinished research despite being told to send what he has, showing dedication and persistence.
Uses the big office formerly used by a respected writer, works alone late at night with organized materials, demonstrates focus and self-discipline.
Responds confidently to the fact checker's pointed remark about his age and typing ability, indicating self-assurance and basic skills.

Takes deep breath and contemplates being honest and unmerciful as advice for true friendship.
Admits he is not cool but is self-aware about it.
Feels distraught but is open to honest advice and prepared to be unmercifully honest in return.
Reflects on his situation realistically, showing insight rather than delusion.
Sleeps restlessly nearby, mouth agape, sitting upright in a plastic chair while others discuss his manuscript.

Sits restlessly with mouth agape nearby as others discuss and validate his work, showing signs of insecurity or lack of confidence.
Manuscript contains detailed and truthful information verified by fact-checkers, demonstrating thoroughness and skill.
Fails to maintain trusted relationship with the band, who feel betrayed and portrayed negatively, indicating possible social or interpersonal incompetence.
Accepts congratulations from peers, remains beaming despite confusion and pressure.
Is speechless and confused when confronted with accusation of dishonesty.
Receives congratulations from peers indicating initial success and recognition.
Appears speechless and confused when the fact checker reveals the story was mostly fabricated and denied by the band.

Fails to anticipate the fact checking process or prepare adequately, resulting in the story being discredited and himself being undermined publicly.
Sits quietly without confrontation when doubted, too tired and still in shock; responds minimally and exits without further engagement.
Accepts sister Anita's invitation to have an adventure together.
Whistles a family whistle to call sister and brother, showing connection to family.
Passes to his mother's left with suitcase, intentionally nudging her into his sister.
Appears withdrawn and depressed in the airport, sitting like a zombie and looking woeful.
Moves like a zombie through the airport, collapses into a seat, looks woeful, and seems emotionally and physically drained.
Whistles the family whistle to call his siblings and manage the situation at home despite his state.
Intentionally nudges his mother into his sister, indicating subtle assertiveness or control in a difficult family interaction.

Watches his mother and sister bonding over his failure silently and retreats to his room, quickly falling asleep with clothes on.
